channel.title: Need advice on unpacking .dll
channel.description:
Hello !
I'm trying to unpack a [.dll](https://help.autodesk.com/view/MAXDEV/2022/ENU/?guid=Max_Developer_Help_writing_plug_ins_creating_a_plug_in_project_manually_creating_a_new_plug_in_plug_in_file_extensions_html), witch protected by VMProtect.(Win64/Packed.VMProtect.L). DIE detect VMProtect 3.2 - 3.5. I have tried changing the entry point and rename functions with x96dbg and IDA, using another similar unprotected .dll as an example. Also I tried to use VMPDump and [NoVMP](https://github.com/can1357/NoVmp) but it looks like I did something wrong - NoVmp throw an error.
Actually I don't know how to fix it and unpack the .dll for future editing. Please, help to understand how to do that.
Here is the [source](https://mega.nz/folder/9zF0mA4Y#AlaltdoeruWBSQPlM5V6-Q).

item.title: Need advice on unpacking .dll
item.dc:creator: questione
item.description:
Hello !

I’m trying to unpack a .dll, witch protected by VMProtect.(Win64/Packed.VMProtect.L). DIE detect VMProtect 3.2 - 3.5.
I have tried changing the entry point and rename functions with x96dbg and IDA, using another similar unprotected .dll as an example.
Also I tried to use VMPDump and NoVMP but it looks like I did something wrong - NoVmp throw an error.

Actually I don’t know how to fix it and unpack the .dll for future editing.
Please, help to understand how to do that.

Here is the source.

Read full topic
